title: join on OnClauseWrapper
body:
<!--
If you want to report a bug, we added some points below you can fill out. If you want to request a feature, feel free to remove all the irrelevant text. In addition to this [issue tracker](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues), you can also talk to Diesel maintainers and users on [Gitter](https://gitter.im/diesel-rs/diesel).
-->

## Setup

### Versions

- **Rust:**
rustc 1.37.0 (eae3437df 2019-08-13)
- **Diesel:**
1.4.2
- **Database:**
mariadb 15.1
- **Operating System**
Debian buster 

### Feature Flags

- **diesel:**
features = ["mysql", "chrono"] 

## Problem Description
It seems we can't do a join on an explicit OnClauseWrapper.

@weiznich advise me to open an issue for this problem. 

Feel free to ask if you need more information.

### What are you trying to accomplish?
An equivalent of this SQL query:
```
select * 
from table1
inner join table2 on table1.id = table2.t1_id and table2.type = "my_type"
left outer join table3 on table2.id = table3.t2_id
```

For that I'm doing:
```
table1.inner_join(table2.ON(...).left_outer_join(table3))
```
<!-- ### What is the expected output? -->

### What is the actual output?
I get this error message:
```
error[E0599]: no method named `left_outer_join` found for type `diesel::query_source::joins::OnClauseWrapper<schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::table, diesel::expression::operators::And<diesel::expression::operators::Eq<schema::glpi_computers::columns::id, schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::columns::items_id>, diesel::expression::operators::Eq<schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::columns::itemtype, diesel::expression::bound::Bound<diesel::sql_types::Nullable<diesel::sql_types::Text>, &str>>>>` in the current scope
  --> src/queries.rs:91:14
   |
91 |             .left_outer_join(glpi_operatingsystems::table.on(glpi_items_operatingsystems::operatingsystems_id.eq(glpi_operatingsystems::id)))
   |              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: the method `left_outer_join` exists but the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
           `&diesel::query_source::joins::OnClauseWrapper<schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::table, diesel::expression::operators::And<diesel::expression::operators::Eq<schema::glpi_computers::columns::id, schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::columns::items_id>, diesel::expression::operators::Eq<schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::columns::itemtype, diesel::expression::bound::Bound<diesel::sql_types::Nullable<diesel::sql_types::Text>, &str>>>> : diesel::QueryDsl`
           `&mut diesel::query_source::joins::OnClauseWrapper<schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::table, diesel::expression::operators::And<diesel::expression::operators::Eq<schema::glpi_computers::columns::id, schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::columns::items_id>, diesel::expression::operators::Eq<schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::columns::itemtype, diesel::expression::bound::Bound<diesel::sql_types::Nullable<diesel::sql_types::Text>, &str>>>> : diesel::QueryDsl`
           `diesel::query_source::joins::OnClauseWrapper<schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::table, diesel::expression::operators::And<diesel::expression::operators::Eq<schema::glpi_computers::columns::id, schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::columns::items_id>,
diesel::expression::operators::Eq<schema::glpi_items_operatingsystems::columns::itemtype, diesel::expression::bound::Bound<diesel::sql_types::Nullable<diesel::sql_types::Text>, &str>>>> : diesel::QueryDsl`

```

<!-- ### Are you seeing any additional errors? -->

### Steps to reproduce
I did a small poc for reproducing the error:

main.rs
```
#[macro_use]
extern crate diesel;

use diesel::prelude::*;


table! {
    table1 (id) {
        id -> Integer,
    }
}
table! {
    table2 (id) {
        id -> Integer,
        t1_id -> Integer,
        t2_type -> Nullable<Varchar>,
    }
}
table! {
    table3 (id) {
        id -> Integer,
        t2_id -> Integer,
    }
}
allow_tables_to_appear_in_same_query!(
    table1,
    table2,
    table3
);

fn main() {
    let results = table1::table
        .inner_join(table2::table.on(table1::id.eq(table2::t1_id).and(table2::t2_type.eq("my_type")))
                    .left_outer_join(table3::table)
        )
        .select((table1::id, table2::id));

        println!("Hello, world!");
}

```
Cargo.toml
```
[package]
name = "join-poc"
version = "0.1.0"
authors = ["Yann <yann@fery.me>"]
edition = "2018"

# See more keys and their definitions at https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html

[dependencies]
diesel = { version = "1.4.2", features = ["mysql", "chrono"] }
```
## Checklist

- [x] I have already looked over the [issue tracker](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues) for similar issues.
- [x] This issue can be reproduced on Rust's stable channel. (Your issue will be
  closed if this is not the case)

Thank you for your submission!  You're helping make Diesel more robust ðŸŽ‰

We'll try to respond as quickly as possible.
-->
